intro: Microchilus panamanicus, commonly known as the Panamanian microchilus, is a flowering plant native to Panama. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Microchilus panamanicus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to forest biodiversity.
